Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server

Class RemoteConnection

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.Observable
it.polimi.ingsw.network.Connection
it.polimi.ingsw.server.RemoteConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class RemoteConnection
extends Connection
This class represents the server-side endpoint of a client-server socket connection

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void close()
    Closes the Connection by the closing of the ObjectOutputStream and the ObjectInputStream.
    java.lang.String getNickname()
    Getter for the nickname of the player associated with this remoteConnection
    void init()
    This method initializes this remoteConnection, building the object streams for network communication and executing the "handshaking" phase with che client, during which the client has to insert a valid nickname and number of players before it can start a game.
    void run()
    A remoteConnection continuously waits for Events from the network.
    void startPinger()
    This method starts the pingerThread associated with this remoteConnection

  • Constructor Details

    • RemoteConnection

      public RemoteConnection​(java.net.Socket socket, Server server)

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      This method initializes this remoteConnection, building the object streams for network communication and executing the "handshaking" phase with che client, during which the client has to insert a valid nickname and number of players before it can start a game. If any communication exception is thrown during those operations, the connection is automatically closed and the client disconnected

    • getNickname

      public java.lang.String getNickname()
      Getter for the nickname of the player associated with this remoteConnection
      Returns:

    • run

      public void run()
      A remoteConnection continuously waits for Events from the network. Any Event received is notified to this clientConnection's observers (a messageReceiver inside a remoteView). If the received event is a DisconnectedEvent, the connection is immediately closed

    • startPinger

      public void startPinger()
      This method starts the pingerThread associated with this remoteConnection

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the Connection by the closing of the ObjectOutputStream and the ObjectInputStream. After this method, the connection is inactive This RemoteConnection is deregistered from the list of active connections maintained by the server
      Overrides:
      close in class Connection
